title: Incorrect sdf file on saving with duplicated plugin

content.raw:
I created a plugin P in models A and B, with models A and B included in model C. The plugin has some customizable parameters and a ```link``` tag.
Also, on editing the model in Gazebo model editor and saving it back. In the new sdf file,

* The sdf is the complete expanded sdf, not with ```<include><uri>...</uri></include>```. Is this the expected behavior?
* The plugin P occurred in saved sdf only once. The saved file contained the information in the model included last. Maybe this is related to #734? IMO, proper handling of namespaces would(?) resolve this. (at least it should) Is there some progress on #734?
* I specified a parameter in plugin P which shared the same name as a link in model A. The sdf converted ```<name>base</name>``` to ```<name>model_c::base</name>```. Can this be optionally prevented? (conversion of some link specified as parameter to relative address)
